snippet: The move to cancel the armistice followed through on a longstanding threat, and came as the United States and South Korea were in the midst of joint military drills.
abstract: North Korea declares 1953 Korean War armistice nullified, following through on longstanding threat that it renewed amid rising tensions with South Korea; move comes as United States and South Korea are in midst of two months of joint military drills.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The move to cancel the armistice followed through on a longstanding threat, and came as the United States and South Korea were in the midst of joint military drills.

headline.seo: North Korea Says It Has Nullified 1953 Armistice
headline.main: North Korea Declares 1953 War Truce Nullified
headline.print_headline: 1953 Armistice Is Nullified, North Korea Declares
